pronunciation: EFFEM'INATE, [Latin effoeminatus, from effoeminor, to grow or make womanish, from foemina, a woman. See Woman.]

definitions.text:
Effeminate
 [Latin effoeminatus, from effoeminor, to grow or make womanish, from foemina, woman. See Woman.]
1. Having the qualities of the female sex; soft or delicate to an unmanly degree; tender; womanish; voluptuous. The king, by his voluptuous life and mean marriage, became effeminate and less sensible of honor.
2. Womanish; weak; resembling the practice or qualities of the sex; as an effeminate peace; an effeminate life.
3. Womanlike, tender, sense not reproachful.
To make womanish; to unman; to weaken; as to effeminate children.
To grow womanish or weak; to melt into weakness. In slothful peace courage will effeminate
